newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey to send 500 troops for Albania aid effort.
newsitem.headline: Turkey to send 500 troops for Albania aid effort.

text.p: Turkey is planning to send 500 troops to Albania to participate in a multinational security force to protect humanitarian relief operations there, Turkish Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan said on Tuesday.
"I hope we will send 500 troops to Albania in the near future," Anatolian news agency quoted Erbakan as saying before he met Carl Bildt, the International High Representative in Bosnia.

The 5,000-strong Albania force is being put together by Italy following approval from the United Nations on Friday. The force is also expected to include contingents from Greece, France, Spain, Romania and Portugal.

Albania wants troops from abroad to help secure ports, airports, roads and railways so that aid can be distributed. Violence spread through Albania in January when a string of popular investment schemes collapsed, wiping out millions of dollars in savings.
Most of the south is now outside government control and the rebels' main demand is that the President Sali Berisha quit.
Erbakan said Turkey would help the country to tackle its economic problems, but gave no more details.
